page.title: 20Alltwen Carnival
page.content: The 1 event that involves the whole village is the yearly Carnival organized and run by Alltwen R.F.C. whose aim is to collect money to promote the game of rugby in this area. The week starts with the choosing of Fairy, Rose and Carnival Queens. In midweek a ladies soccer team competes; a quiz is held another night and Friday night is Mock Carnival Night when men dress up in various costumes (usually as women) and tour the nearby villages with collecting boxes. Saturday is Carnival Day when people dress in fancy costumes and band together to portray various scenes on lorries. After the Carnival parades through the village, the spectators and competitors throng to the school grounds where there are side stalls, shows, snacks, judging & brass bands.
